CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1952, pg. 30 reads: "Halloween Celebration - Hill City's annual Halloween celebration this year went off in grand style. First there was a parade of thousands of youngsters throughout the Hill District under the sponsorship of Hill City Youth Municipality and other agencies.  Then prizes were awarded at a reviewing stand at Centre Avenue Police Station. Here the youngsters are shown as they gathered in square near the police station. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children's Halloween parade on the 2000 block of Centre Avenue with Hirsch Cleaners and Tailors, Sandwich Inn, and New Granada Theater, at night, Hill District
